lab

Class AquaFish

  • java.lang.Object
    • lab.AquaFish

  • public class AquaFish
extends java.lang.Object
    Aquarium Lab Series: The AquaFish class defines a fish in an aquarium.
    See Also:
    Aquarium, AquaPoint

    • Constructor Detail

      • AquaFish

        public AquaFish(Aquarium aqua)
        The AquaFish constructor sets properties of the AquaFish. Precondition: the aquarium must be big enough to accommodate the biggest fish (currently 75 pixels long and 30 pixels high) plus 10 pixels of padding in all four directions.
        Parameters:
        aqua - the Aquarium in which to place the fish

      • AquaFish

        public AquaFish(Aquarium aqua,
                java.awt.Color color)
        The AquaFish constructor sets properties of the AquaFish. This version of the constructor allows the user to select the Color to be associated with the fish. Precondition: the aquarium must be big enough to accomodate the biggest fish (currently 75 pixels long and 30 pixels high) plus 10 pixels of padding in all four directions.
        Parameters:
        aqua - the Aquarium in which to place the fish
        color - the Color to associate with the fish

    • Method Detail

      • id

        public int id()
        Get the unique identifier for this fish.
        Returns:
        the ID of the fish

      • color

        public java.awt.Color color()
        Get fish's color.
        Returns:
        the color of this fish

      • position

        public AquaPoint position()
        Get the fish's position in the aquarium.
        Returns:
        the position (point in the aquarium) of the fish

      • length

        public int length()
        Get the length of the fish.
        Returns:
        fish length

      • height

        public int height()
        Get the height of the fish.
        Returns:
        fish height

      • facingRight

        public boolean facingRight()
        Determine whether the fish is facing right.
        Returns:
        true if fish is facing right; false otherwise

      • facingLeft

        public boolean facingLeft()
        Determine whether the fish is facing left.
        Returns:
        true if fish is facing left; false otherwise

      • distanceToWall

        public int distanceToWall()
        Compute how far the fish is from the wall in front of it.
        Returns:
        distance from front of fish to facing wall

      • atWall

        public boolean atWall()
        Determine whether the fish is at a wall. A fish is considered at a wall if it cannot move forward; in other words, if the distance from the fish to the wall it faces is less than the minimum distance that a fish can move forward.
        Returns:
        true if fish is at a wall; false otherwise

      • atSurface

        public boolean atSurface()
        Determine whether the fish is at the surface. A fish is considered at the surface if it cannot ascend; in other words, if the distance from the fish to the surface is less than the fish's height.
        Returns:
        true if fish is at the surface; false otherwise

      • atBottom

        public boolean atBottom()
        Determine whether the fish is at the bottom. A fish is considered at the bottom if it cannot descend; in other words, if the distance from the fish to the bottom is less than the fish's height.
        Returns:
        true if fish is at the bottom; false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This function is provided primarily for debugging purposes.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of a fish

      • moveForward

        public void moveForward()
        Move forward horizontally by random increments, staying within the aquarium.

      • changeDir

        public void changeDir()
        Reverse direction.

      • initSize

        private void initSize()
        Initialize fish size: This helper function determines the height and length of the fish. Fish are evenly distributed among 4 different sizes based on their ID numbers.

      • initPos

        private void initPos()
        Initialize fish position and direction. This helper function assigns coordinates to a fish such that the fish is placed within the bounds of the Aquarium. Precondition: the aquarium must be big enough to accomodate the biggest fish (currently 75 pixels long and 30 pixels high) plus 10 pixels of padding in all four directions.
